channel.title: compilers on Reside-IC
channel.description: Recent content in compilers on Reside-IC

item.title: Debugging at the edge of reason
item.description:
What do you do if this code…
printf("Before loop
"); while ((a>0) && (b>0)) { printf("Inside loop
"); // Other loop code } if (a>0) printf("a>0
"); if (b>0) printf("b>0
"); if ((a>0) && (b>0)) printf("Both a>0 and b>0!");  …produces this output?
Before loop a>0 b>0 Both a>0 and b>0!  If a and b are both above zero, then why didn’t the while-loop do any iteration; why didn’t we see Inside loop in the output?
